summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to a Department of Justice employee being asked to provide information voluntarily as part of an investigation. The form includes a waiver section for the employee to acknowledge understanding and willingness to participate.
keyFacts: The document is an OIG Form 111-226/2 (dated 05/03/21) used for non-custodial/employee interviews.
The investigation is being conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General pursuant to the Inspector General Act of 1978.
The employee is being asked to provide information on a voluntary basis and is informed that no disciplinary action will be taken if they choose not to answer.
Any statement provided may be used as evidence in future criminal or agency disciplinary proceedings.
The specific subject of the investigation is redacted in the provided text.
